meanings.definition: To strike with a hammer or tool, especially to flatten or shape metal.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith peened the hot iron to create a horseshoe.
meanings.sent2: The worker peened the metal sheet to make it thinner.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome peened the metal bell, making it ring oddly.
meanings.sent4: Her words peened his heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of peening echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: The flattened or shaped end of a metal object, resulting from being struck with a hammer.
meanings.sent1: The peened edge of the sword gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The peened tip of the nail was securely embedded in the wood.
meanings.sent3: The tiny peened bump on the key made it difficult to turn.
meanings.sent4: His peened badge shone proudly on his uniform.
meanings.sent5: The peened surface of the shield showed the marks of battle.
